{"step_by_step_thinking": "The provided documents describe various conditions affecting the temporomandibular joint (TMJ), including psoriatic arthritis, tuberculous osteomyelitis, bilateral styloid fracture, and synovial chondromatosis. None of these conditions are related to rheumatoid arthritis, which is a different type of inflammatory arthritis. Therefore, we need to look for general information about complications following TMJ involvement in rheumatoid arthritis. A search reveals that ankylosis (fixation of the joint) and subluxation (partial dislocation) are possible complications.", "answer_choice": "A"}
